metadata.Title: CVE-2022-36760 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling') vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.54 and prior versions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
apache2-bin - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
apache2-data - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
apache2-utils - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.52-1ubuntu4.3').
